form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Reid (for himself, Mr. Durbin, Mr. Schumer, Mrs. Gillibrand, Mr. Lautenberg, Mr. Menendez, Mr. Brown, Mr. Schatz, Mr. Sanders, Mrs. Boxer, Mr. Blumenthal, Mr. Cardin, Mr. Coons, and Mr. Levin) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: Expressing the sense of the Senate on the need to enact legislation to eliminate wasteful tax loopholes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the End Wasteful Tax Loopholes Act .

section.header: Sense of the Senate on the elimination of tax loopholes
section.text: It is the sense of the Senate that Congress should enact legislation toâ€”

paragraph.text: eliminate wasteful tax loopholes that create incentives for taxpayers to engage in transactions that have no economic substance solely to lower their tax bills;
eliminate corporate tax loopholes and wasteful tax breaks for special interests;
crack down on tax cheaters and close the tax gap;
address provisions in the Federal tax code that make it more profitable for companies to create jobs overseas than in the United States; and
reform the Federal tax code in a manner that promotes job creation, competitiveness, and economic growth in the United States.
